description: Sven Halek, facing an unstable power balance, delivers Halden's spiral override sabotage protocols to Directorate-loyal councils with instructions to secretly disrupt rival BCI scoring systems and regain Directorate control.

Shortly after deployment, Directorate-loyal and competing councils begin secretly sabotaging each other's overrides. BCI scoring disruptions escalate, causing critical service interruptions in healthcare, food distribution, and labor assignments.

Widespread confusion and mistrust erupts as citizens realize BCI sabotage is influencing essential resources. Street protests break out, with neighborhoods demanding an end to inter-council manipulation.

Resource delivery failures and growing unrest prompt Oksana Lintz and Nikola Petrak to call urgent talks with key zone leaders, proposing an immediate pause on override use and collective oversight to halt the chaos.

A fragile citywide truce is brokered: councils agree to suspend all override-based BCI edits, implement transparent adjustments under public scrutiny, and restore basic services as citizens demand lasting cooperation.
